term.title: surface states

item.text: Energy levels localized in the surface region of semiconductors, which do not bear any direct relation to the bulk energy distribution, but which can exchange electrons with the bulk. In such a case a space charge may arise even when σ (the free charge density) is zero, i.e. σ = σ sc + σ ss, where σ sc is the space charge density and σ ss is the charge density associated with the surface states.

sources.item: PAC, 1986, 58, 437. 'Interphases in systems of conducting phases (Recommendations 1985)' on page 443 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198658030437)
